docs.text: This will be a place where I organize what I've studied.

docs.title: combustion
docs.text: A rapid exothermic osidation process which delivers hot products.

docs.title: Frame
docs.text: A self-sustaining propagation of a localized combustion zone. From atomic scale perspective, a radiating plasma in which the high temperature strips some of the electrons from their nuclei.

docs.title: Why combustion is important?
docs.text: Combustion provide us a large fraction of energy for transportation, electricity, residential heating, commercial energy needs, and military applications.

docs.title: Negative impacts
docs.text:
• Atmospheric pollution
    • Particulate pollutants: smoke, soot, fly ash, dust
    • Gaseout pollutants: SOx, NOx
  • Global warming and climate change

docs.title: Main Objective of combustion science and technology
docs.text:
1. Design safe and reliable combustion system
  2. Maximize thermal efficiency and minimize fuel consumption
  3. Minimize pollutant emissions and climate change/impact

docs.title: Type of combustion depending on mixing of fuel and oxidizer
